repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Agricultural
            Institutions Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Agricultural Institutions
            Development Project in Madagascar was successful. The
            Industrial Sector Adjustment Credit (ISAC) marked the start
            of a new direction in Madagascar's economic policy. The
            economy badly needed the Credit during its external and
            internal financial stabilization, primarily to provide the
            necessary foreign exchange for imported inputs to be used in
            production and spare parts. Although it was very difficult
            to simultaneously carry out a policy to restart growth in
            production and reestablish internal and external balance,
            the Government was clearly committed to undertaking a series
            of reforms to increase the performance of the industrial
            sector. ISAC was the first step on that road. Difficulties
            were encountered but the phased approach to implementing the
            Credit was well suited to a difficult economic environment
            in which the reforms could be only a starting point for a
            market-oriented economy.

repnme.cdata!:
Madagascar - Second Agricultural
            Institutions Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project includes strengthening
            programs for major institutions responsible for agricultural
            policy and services. These programs consist of technical
            assistance, short term consultancies, joint
            Government-consultant policy reviews, training, study tours,
            and equipment and supplies. The project supports sector
            policy analysis, public expenditure analysis, parastatal
            monitoring and restructuring, personnel management,
            information systems, and extension systems for the Ministry
            of Agricultural Production and Agrarian Reform (MPARA). It
            furthermore supports sector policy analysis, public
            expenditure analysis, personnel management, parastatal
            monitoring, facilities management and information systems
            for the Ministry of Livestock, Fisheries and Forestry
            (MPAEF). Finally, the project supports activities in
            research planning and programming for the Ministry of
            Scientific and Technological Research (MRSTD), the National
            Center for Applied Research on Rural Development (F OF IFA)
            as well as natural resources inventory; land use analysis
            and monitoring for MRSTD.
